summary: Clinton claimed that she is running for president to remove barriers and create opportunities for all Americans, especially those who have been left behind. She acknowledged that many Americans are angry about the economy, as they haven't had a raise in 15 years and there aren't enough good-paying jobs, particularly for young people. Clinton also agreed with Sanders that unaccountable money needs to be removed from the political system and that more needs to be done to prevent Wall Street from negatively impacting the economy.
SANDERS claimed to the audience at the Democratic debate in Milwaukee on February 11th, 2016 that healthcare is a right of all people, not a privilege, and he will fight for that.

Sanders claimed during the Democratic debate in Milwaukee on February 11th, 2016 that disastrous trade policies, such as NAFTA and Permanent Normal Trade Relations with China, have allowed corporate America to shut down factories in the United States and send jobs to China, resulting in lower wages for high school graduates.
During the Democratic debate in Milwaukee on February 11th, 2016, Hillary Clinton claimed that she has a plan to create jobs and raise incomes for the American people.
